page.title: 04AN UNHEALTHY SITUATION
page.content: The people of Alvington are very poorly catered for as regards their health. There is no General Practioner in the village, patients have to go to nearby Aylburton or Lydney. Dentists, Opticians and Chiropodists are all in Lydney. The nearest hospital is also in Lydney which caters mainly for geriatrics and minor surgery. There are X-Ray, physiotherapy and some casualty facilities plus family planning and out patient clinics and a day centre for the elderly. All other health care has been centralised at the main Gloucester city hospital, including Obsteterics and maternity care. As part of the Social services meals on wheels are provided twice a week, Tuesdays and Thursdays, for the infirm senior citizens.
